questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using Lasso and Ridge regression in this experiment?

answers.a: To improve prediction accuracy and control overfitting through regularization
answers.b: To make the model more complex
answers.c: To increase the number of coefficients

explanations.a: Correct! Lasso and Ridge reduce overfitting and improve accuracy by penalizing large coefficients.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Regularization simplifies the model instead of making it more complex.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Regularization typically reduces coefficient values.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Regularization has no role in reducing dataset size.

questions.question: Which regression technique performs automatic feature selection?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Linear Regression includes all features.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Ridge shrinks coefficients but does not eliminate them.
explanations.c: Correct! Lasso can shrink coefficients exactly to zero, removing irrelevant features.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Only Lasso performs feature selection.

questions.question: How does Ridge regression help improve model stability when predictors are correlated?

answers.a: By assigning higher weights to correlated features
answers.b: By using L2 regularization to shrink coefficients
answers.c: By setting correlated feature coefficients to zero
answers.d: By removing correlated features from the dataset

explanations.b: Correct! L2 regularization stabilizes coefficients when predictors are correlated.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Setting coefficients to zero is performed by Lasso, not Ridge.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Ridge does not delete features.

questions.question: Which metric is commonly used to evaluate regression model performance in this experiment?

explanations.a: Partially correct, but not the only metric used.
explanations.b: Partially correct, but it is only one of the performance metrics.
explanations.c: Partially correct, but RMSE alone is insufficient.
explanations.d: Correct! MSE, RMSE, and R² are all used to compare model performance.

questions.question: Which type of penalty does Lasso regression apply?

explanations.a: Incorrect. L2 is used in Ridge.
explanations.b: Correct! Lasso uses an L1 penalty that encourages sparsity.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Combination is used in ElasticNet.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Lasso always applies L1 regularization.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE about Linear Regression compared to Lasso and Ridge?

answers.a: It performs better when the dataset contains noise and multicollinearity
answers.b: It does not apply any regularization
answers.d: It shrinks coefficients but never sets them to zero

explanations.a: Incorrect. Linear Regression performs poorly when noise or multicollinearity is present.
explanations.b: Correct! Linear Regression uses no regularization by default.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Only Lasso removes irrelevant features.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This describes Ridge, not Linear Regression.
